channel_info.title: The Rational Male
channel_info.description: The Rational Male is the official YouTube channel of Rollo Tomassi, author of The Rational Male series of books and blogs. Often called the Godfather of the Manosphere, Rollo has been the most influential thought leader of the Red Pill for over 20 years. Rollo discusses issues of intersexual dynamics, and relationships,  topics from the books, unplugging from 'The Matrix', and Red Pill awareness.

comments.author: @LuckyMNplayboi
comments.text:
Love you Rollo and have purchased and read all of your books. But if I can give a piece of constructive criticism if you care to hear it.

The Rational Male podclass has become almost useless for the last year or so, in my opinion. There's very little useful/actionable information and it has become hours of: complaining about other YouTubers, reminding everyone that you've been married for 20-some-odd-years, that X-person is a derivative of your work, talking about people throwing rocks at you, etc.

It's not my job to tell you how to do your show and I wish you all the success in the world but it seems like these days you just do livestreams for the sake of doing livestreams. 

Love ya regardless Rollo, and I will still continue to buy copies of your books for people I think would benefit from them. Keep us updated on the program for older guys,  I'd love to hear how that's going.

comments.author: @aniketbisht2823
comments.text:
Stoicism is more about understanding than anything else. Understanding of what? I would say everything from human nature to hard sciences. Everything you can get your hands on. There is a quote "Try to learn something about everything and everything about something". Knowing more helps you play "the game" better. This is where the Red Pill comes in, in context of inter-sexual dynamics.
Some people misunderstand Stoicism as not caring or not giving a fuck but what it really means is that you understand the nature of the particular situation so well that you can discern what is under your control and what is not. Hence you don't fret over anything outside your control and give your complete effort to change what you can.

Writing fiction- first tell a story, focus on the story. Don't turn it into a lecture- from my favorite Sci-Fi author:

“I have no objection to the expression of political opinions in SF if they are an integral part of the story structure. I don't at all appreciate their intrusion for the purpose of converting a story into a political tract, because I consider that intellectually insulting.” 
― Roger Zelazny


Make the actions of a character consistent (demonstrate don't explicate) and logical within the context of the story.

comments.author: @toddmcdaniels1567
comments.text:
The problem is not that subjects are paid a nominal incentive online or otherwise.  The problem is that critical to the nature of the experiment was a selection process for certain vaguely defined population, compromised in part by poor criteria for selection.  They could certainly operationalize Incel, but it does not appear that this was done, and one must be careful about how one reports the findings when one is not using an objective definition of a population of Incels but an operational definition.  Is there even a definable group, or is it just family resemblance all the way through?  One would also need to address the representativeness of participants within even the operational definition of the group in question, and that is a problem with an online selection process.

There are many studies that recruit and pay people online in which the only criteria for selection for participation is that the subject be a legal adult and a speaker of English.  These are far less problematic.

comments.author: @aniketbisht2823
comments.text:
Only listening to F&F and not exploring the depth and breadth of inter-sexual dynamics can be dangerous for guys. These type of guys only have a superficial "knowledge" of the Red Pill.
 Casually surfing one women-only subreddit revealed that there are guys who send F&F quotes to their date/girlfriend like "Women are interested in a man's future and men are interested in a woman's past" and when asked to elaborate on it (called on their shit), are not able to defend their point and make a fool out of themselves. Of course, sharing them in the first place is stupid as women don't want you to "reveal" the game but to play it and also "Demonstrate, don't explicate".     
F&F are great for making the Red Pill "mainstream" (I was introduced to Rollo through them) and they do have some sound advice regarding some specific topics but it should be one's duty (to themselves) to explore deeper. As Rollo once said "Its a college course, not an elevator pitch).

transcription: Tell me a sound that's better than this. We will be taking all your questions today, I'm going to do a little bit of an AMA, I got a few things I want to get into my ear and review. Am I in time to re-introduce myself? Yes, you're correct, I am really a trans male. Got it. If that's acting to turn me into a trans male, you're right. 100% right. Rowell said he was really a trans male. Hey, live from the biggest little city in the world, Reno, Nevada, deep in the heart of the Nevada high desert, I am Rowell Otamasi in the Northern Command Center of Red One Studios. And now, this. Reason why men date younger women is not because of their physical appearance, their bodies, no, because today with plastic surgery and everything else, you barely know who is 40 and who is 18. Guys date younger women because they're easily manipulated, they're going to be very happy with a few crumbs because maybe they didn't experience much in the world, they're going to be just easily impressed. And it's way cheaper to date a younger girl. Have you ever had a dream that you had, you could, you do, you want. Men that still kind of push this narrative that like women with very high body count is a sub-woman. Why do you think they still do that? They say they do it because of the research on body count, which shows that people with higher body counts are more likely to be unfaithful, they're less likely to be satisfied in monogamous relationships, more likely to get divorced, you know, there's a lot of negative correlations with body count. And they say that it's because of the research, but then it's like the research shows the same effects in men. And you're not saying that men with high body counts are problematic. Oftentimes, these same guys are saying that men with high body counts are like successful or good. So it's like, it doesn't seem to be a research driven idea. My friend Alexander, who's a graduate student, he ran a survey and it wasn't a representative sample, but he found that the men who cared the most about body counts were the least sexually successful. The underlying factor that we see is that men who care more about body count, at least in his survey, tended to have more body counts themselves. It could be because they have religious beliefs about that, it could be higher disgust sensitivity. So they're obviously not going to have casual sex if they're really easily grossed out by that kind of thing. Or it could be sour grapes. This was Alexander's theory, which was that you can't reach the grapes, so they're too sour. The woman who are having lots of sex don't want to have sex with you, and so you say you wouldn't want to anyway. So it could be that. And these are all hypotheses. None of these are tested. I think part of it is sexual insecurity. I think that that comes from the fact. So I guess we should take it all with a grain of salt, right, Mac? That there's just more points of comparison. Statistically, if you're sleeping with a woman for the first time and she slept with nine other guys, let's say, and you're number 10, it's just all else being equal, 10% chance that you're the best ever. If it's 99 guys and you're number 100, it's a 1% chance. I mean, everyone's going to tell you that you're their best sexual experience. But most of the times, if they've slept with lots of people, that's going to be a lie. Some men know that and they won't admit it. I think that that's why some men care about body count. Well, I'm a whore! Body count. 20. 20. Let me go to my notes app. I'll just show it to the camera. This is the list. So, you know, we got all that. Period. I don't regret a single one. We all have fun. This has got to be at least 60. At least 60. She got 60? I have more than that. Are we counting work or not work? Because I do this for work. So if we're counting work, I don't know. If we're not counting work, like 98. Never mind, I am. I want to catch up to her, so I am going to f*** another guy. I am. I said I wasn't, but now I am. I've got to catch up. What's the optimum amount of people to have on a roster at any one time? No more than five, because you might start calling them the wrong names. Call them all bae. Five is too much. It's like a small basketball team. But nobody off the bench, though, so nobody can get hurt. Got it. How do you keep the feelings out of play? Never tell them your real name and don't tell them you love them. Okay. There you go. Noted. Writing this down, I am. For me, I don't let men day text me if they're on a roster. I don't want any kind of like, hey, how's your day going? It's like I don't want any mental energy. I don't mind that, but no holidays together. So don't ask me what I'm doing for Thanksgiving and Christmas. Nothing. Holiday alone. I'm doing nothing. At home, two cats. Yeah, yeah. I like your vibe. Thank you, I try. Percent of single women are open and looking for single dads. Why we like dads. Great question. Glad you asked. They are. We more stable, more mature, and they're less likely to play games. Or just like single women are looking for single 60% of single child. All women, single women are looking for men with kids because they feel like they are more relatable, more responsible, more committed, more loving. You guys are not. No, they are toxic us who love baby mama drama. All men with kids come with baby mama. All men with kids come with baby mama drama.
